001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump;
002
003import java.util.Map;
004import java.util.stream.Stream;
005
006/**
007 * This interface represents the ability to dump the data of JSON-like and YAML-like
008 * hierarchical structure in multicolor TEXT-base, HTML-base and SVG-base formats
009 *
010 * @see <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visitor_pattern">(Wikipedia) Visitor pattern</a>
011 * @see <a href="https://www.baeldung.com/java-visitor-pattern">
012 *     (Baeldung) Visitor Design Pattern in Java
013 * </a>
014 * @see <a href="https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/system-design/visitor-design-pattern/">
015 *     (Geeks For Geeks) Visitor design pattern
016 * </a>
017 * @see <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/visitor-design-pattern-java">
018 *     (Digital Ocean) Visitor Design Pattern in Java
019 * </a>
020 */
021public interface TreeDumper {
022
023    interface Node {
024        default String identity() { return null; }
025        default String comment() { return null; }
026        void visit(TreeDumper dumper);
027    }
028
029    interface ScalarNode extends Node {
030        String text();
031    }
032
033    interface SequenceNode extends Node {
034        Stream<Node> sequenceItems();
035    }
036
037    interface MappingsNode extends Node {
038        Stream<Map.Entry<String, Node>> mappingsItems();
039    }
040
041    Node NULL = TreeDumper::acceptNull;
042
043    void acceptNull();
044    void acceptScalar(ScalarNode scalarNode);
045    void acceptSequence(SequenceNode sequenceNode);
046    void acceptMappings(MappingsNode mappingsNode);
047
048    default void acceptRoot(Node rootNode) {
049        rootNode.visit(this);
050    }
051}
